column4: try right clicking on the volume control app (may have to double right click), then select preferences, then select PCM as item to control.
Didn't work :(
hmm...try opening up the mixer, by double clicking the speaker icons (with left button this time), when it is up, see which controls move when you use the computer buttons
They don't budge
Oh yeah... it's a capture thing that moves
which controls do you have
on the mixer :)
Huh? There's a lot here...but the settings is set to PCM
weird
agree, if settings are set to pcm, should work...
You know if there is any config-file which controls the mapping between the volume buttons and the channel it controls?
Do I have to restart X to make the configuration change ?
should not have to restart X...let me look around some
i found an rc file: ~/.gnome2/gnome-volume-control, but all it has in mine is where to dock at :(
can you check again by right clicking on the volume control, doing preferences, and see what is selected as item to control?
hehe.. it's still PCM
you got me...sorry
hmm... is there any way I can run this with sudo ?
dunno, a lot of the gnome/gtk stuff doesn't like to run as root
I'm just thinking I might have done it before, and sat the preferences wrong
sounds likely then
I'm giving up for now... thanks though :)
